alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Pickens (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 11:50AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Pickens, southwestern Fayette and southeastern Lamar Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1150 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Millport, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gordo, Reform, Millport, Carrollton, Pickensville, Kennedy, Ethelsville, Ashcraft Corner, North Pickens Airport, McShan, Shaw, Owens, Lubbub, Forest and Macedonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
